questions.question_text: What is the phonetic alphabet word for the letter 'J'?
options: Joker
Juliet
Japan
Jump
questions.correct_answer: Juliet

questions.question_text: The phrase 'ROGER' means:
options: I will comply with your instruction.
I have received all of your last transmission.
Yes, that is correct.
Please repeat your message.
questions.correct_answer: I have received all of your last transmission.

questions.question_text: What does the word 'AFFIRM' mean in radiotelephony?
options: Maybe
Yes
I understand
No
questions.correct_answer: Yes

questions.question_text: If a pilot is instructed to do something and will comply, the correct response is:
options: ROGER
AFFIRMATIVE
WILCO
OKAY
questions.correct_answer: WILCO

questions.question_text: How should the altitude 5,000 feet be spoken?
options: FIVE THOUSAND FEET
FIFTY HUNDRED FEET
FIFE ZERO ZERO ZERO FEET
FLIGHT LEVEL FIFTY
questions.correct_answer: FIVE THOUSAND FEET

questions.question_text: The phrase 'SAY AGAIN' instructs the other party to:
options: Speak louder.
Wait for a moment.
Repeat the last transmission.
Acknowledge the message.
questions.correct_answer: Repeat the last transmission.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to pronounce the number '9' in aviation?
options: NINE
NINER
NINETY
NINTH
questions.correct_answer: NINER

questions.question_text: The term 'STANDBY' means:
options: The transmission is finished.
Proceed with your message.
Wait and I will call you.
The frequency is busy.
questions.correct_answer: Wait and I will call you.

questions.question_text: How is the frequency 122.8 MHz transmitted?
options: ONE TWENTY-TWO EIGHT
ONE TWO TWO POINT EIGHT
ONE TWO TWO DECIMAL EIGHT
ONE DOUBLE TWO EIGHT
questions.correct_answer: ONE TWO TWO DECIMAL EIGHT

questions.question_text: What does the phrase 'READ BACK' mean?
options: Read the weather report.
Acknowledge the message.
Repeat the message back as understood.
Read the flight instruments.
questions.correct_answer: Repeat the message back as understood.

questions.question_text: The word 'NEGATIVE' is used to mean:
options: Only 'No'.
'No', or 'Permission not granted', or 'That is not correct'.
I did not receive your message.
The situation is unfavorable.
questions.correct_answer: 'No', or 'Permission not granted', or 'That is not correct'.

questions.question_text: How should a heading of 080 degrees be transmitted?
options: HEADING EIGHTY
HEADING EIGHT ZERO
HEADING ZERO EIGHT ZERO
HEADING ZERO EIGHTY
questions.correct_answer: HEADING ZERO EIGHT ZERO

questions.question_text: What does 'ACKNOWLEDGE' mean?
options: Repeat the message back.
Let me know that you have received and understood this message.
Comply with the instruction.
The transmission is over.
questions.correct_answer: Let me know that you have received and understood this message.

questions.question_text: How is the time 0920Z spoken?
options: NINE TWENTY ZULU
ZERO NINER TWO ZERO ZULU
OH NINE TWENTY ZULU
NINER HUNDRED TWENTY ZULU
questions.correct_answer: ZERO NINER TWO ZERO ZULU

questions.question_text: The phrase 'GO AHEAD' means:
options: Proceed with your message.
Take off now.
Continue taxiing.
The frequency is clear.
questions.correct_answer: Proceed with your message.

questions.question_text: What is the first item stated in an initial radio call to a ground station?
options: Your aircraft call sign.
Your request.
The name of the station being called.
Your position on the airport.
questions.correct_answer: The name of the station being called.

questions.question_text: How is Flight Level 210 transmitted?
options: FLIGHT LEVEL TWENTY ONE THOUSAND
FLIGHT LEVEL TWO ONE ZERO
FLIGHT LEVEL TWO HUNDRED TEN
FLIGHT LEVEL TWO ONE OH
questions.correct_answer: FLIGHT LEVEL TWO ONE ZERO

questions.question_text: The phrase 'CORRECTION' is used when:
options: The other person has made a mistake.
An error has been made in the current transmission.
You want to change your request.
ATC has given an incorrect instruction.
questions.correct_answer: An error has been made in the current transmission.

questions.question_text: What does 'ATIS' stand for?
options: Aircraft Traffic Information System
Airport Terminal Information Service
Automatic Terminal Information Service
Aeronautical Traffic Information Standard
questions.correct_answer: Automatic Terminal Information Service

questions.question_text: How is a transponder code of 4212 spoken?
options: FORTY-TWO TWELVE
FOUR TWO ONE TWO
FOUR THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED TWELVE
FOUR-TWO-ONE-TWO
questions.correct_answer: FOUR TWO ONE TWO

questions.question_text: A readability of '5' on the readability scale means the transmission is:
options: Readable now and then.
Unreadable.
Readable but with difficulty.
Perfectly readable.
questions.correct_answer: Perfectly readable.

questions.question_text: What does the phrase 'MONITOR' instruct a pilot to do?
options: Watch the flight instruments closely.
Listen out on the specified frequency.
Observe traffic in the vicinity.
Check the weather.
questions.correct_answer: Listen out on the specified frequency.

questions.question_text: How is an altimeter setting of 29.89 transmitted?
options: ALTIMETER TWO NINER EIGHT NINER
ALTIMETER TWENTY-NINE EIGHTY-NINE
ALTIMETER TWO NINER DECIMAL EIGHT NINER
ALTIMETER TWO NINE EIGHT NINE
questions.correct_answer: ALTIMETER TWO NINER DECIMAL EIGHT NINER

questions.question_text: The phrase 'BREAK BREAK' is used to:
options: Indicate an emergency.
Separate messages to different aircraft in a busy environment.
End a transmission.
Signal a communication failure.
questions.correct_answer: Separate messages to different aircraft in a busy environment.

questions.question_text: What is the standard VFR transponder code in the USA?
A request 'HOW DO YOU READ?' is asking for what?
options: Your opinion on the situation.
A report on the readability of the transmission.
You to repeat the message.
Your current flight parameters.
questions.correct_answer: A report on the readability of the transmission.

questions.question_text: How is runway 36L transmitted?
options: RUNWAY THIRTY-SIX LIMA
RUNWAY THREE SIX LEFT
RUNWAY THIRTY-SIX LEFT
RUNWAY THREE-SIX-L
questions.correct_answer: RUNWAY THREE SIX LEFT

questions.question_text: The phrase 'OUT' at the end of a transmission means:
options: I am leaving the frequency.
My transmission is ended and I expect a response.
This exchange is ended and no response is expected.
I am outside of your airspace.
questions.correct_answer: This exchange is ended and no response is expected.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to state you have received ATIS information 'Charlie'?
options: WITH CHARLIE
ROGER CHARLIE
INFORMATION CHARLIE
I HAVE CHARLIE
questions.correct_answer: WITH INFORMATION CHARLIE

questions.question_text: How is a wind from 240 degrees at 15 knots, gusting to 25 knots, transmitted?
options: WIND TWO FOUR ZERO AT ONE FIVE GUSTING TWO FIVE
WIND 240 AT 15 GUSTS 25
WIND TWO FORTY AT FIFTEEN, GUSTS TWENTY-FIVE
WIND TWO FOUR ZERO DEGREES AT ONE FIVE KNOTS, GUSTING TWO FIVE KNOTS
questions.correct_answer: WIND TWO FOUR ZERO AT ONE FIVE GUSTING TWO FIVE

questions.question_text: A readability of '1' on the readability scale means the transmission is:
options: Perfectly readable.
Readable but with difficulty.
Unreadable.
Readable now and then.
questions.correct_answer: Unreadable.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'DISREGARD' means:
options: The instruction is cancelled.
Consider that transmission as not sent.
Pay no attention to my next words.
You have made an error.
questions.correct_answer: Consider that transmission as not sent.

questions.question_text: What is the transponder code for a hijacking?
What does the Q-code 'QNH' refer to?
options: The magnetic bearing to the station.
The atmospheric pressure at mean sea level.
The height of the aircraft above the airfield.
The atmospheric pressure at the airfield elevation.
questions.correct_answer: The atmospheric pressure at mean sea level.

questions.question_text: When cleared to 'LINE UP AND WAIT', a pilot should:
options: Take off immediately.
Taxi onto the runway and prepare for takeoff, but do not take off.
Wait short of the runway.
Taxi onto the runway and wait for a landing aircraft to pass.
questions.correct_answer: Taxi onto the runway and prepare for takeoff, but do not take off.

questions.question_text: What is the transponder code for a lost communications situation?
The phrase 'REPORT FINAL' is a request to make a radio call when:
options: On the final approach leg of the traffic pattern.
You have finished your flight.
You are on the downwind leg.
You are established on the base leg.
questions.correct_answer: On the final approach leg of the traffic pattern.

questions.question_text: What does the Q-code 'QFE' refer to?
options: The magnetic bearing from the station.
The atmospheric pressure at mean sea level.
The atmospheric pressure at airfield elevation.
The true bearing to the station.
questions.correct_answer: The atmospheric pressure at airfield elevation.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'SQUAWK IDENT' means the pilot should:
options: Verbally state their call sign.
Change their transponder code to the one given.
Activate the 'IDENT' feature on the transponder.
Turn the transponder to standby.
questions.correct_answer: Activate the 'IDENT' feature on the transponder.

questions.question_text: What is the transponder code for a general emergency?
What is the universal emergency frequency (VHF)?
The instruction 'MAINTAIN VFR' means:
options: You are cleared to fly under Visual Flight Rules.
Remain in weather conditions that meet VFR minimums and continue to see and avoid other aircraft.
Contact flight service for a weather update.
The controller cannot provide traffic advisories.
questions.correct_answer: Remain in weather conditions that meet VFR minimums and continue to see and avoid other aircraft.

questions.question_text: What does 'CLEARED FOR THE OPTION' mean for a landing aircraft?
options: The pilot is cleared to perform a touch-and-go, stop-and-go, low approach, or full-stop landing.
The pilot must choose one type of landing and inform the tower.
The pilot is cleared to land on any runway.
The pilot may choose to divert to another airport.
questions.correct_answer: The pilot is cleared to perform a touch-and-go, stop-and-go, low approach, or full-stop landing.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to abbreviate a call sign like 'Cessna 172SP' after initial contact has been established?
options: Cessna 2SP
Cessna 172
The controller or pilot may abbreviate it to the last three characters (e.g., '2SP').
It should not be abbreviated.
questions.correct_answer: The controller or pilot may abbreviate it to the last three characters (e.g., '2SP').

questions.question_text: A pilot receiving the instruction 'RADAR CONTACT' should understand that:
options: They are now under positive radar control.
Their aircraft has been identified on the radar display and flight following will be provided.
They no longer need to make position reports.
They must switch to a new frequency.
questions.correct_answer: Their aircraft has been identified on the radar display and flight following will be provided.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'RESUME OWN NAVIGATION' means:
options: Radar service is terminated.
Proceed to your destination using your planned route.
The controller will no longer provide heading instructions.
All of the above.
questions.correct_answer: All of the above.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of a clearance 'CLEARED TO LAND'?
options: The runway is clear and the pilot is authorized to land.
The pilot is authorized to begin the final approach.
The pilot should expect to land but must wait for final clearance.
The pilot is cleared to join the traffic pattern.
questions.correct_answer: The runway is clear and the pilot is authorized to land.

questions.question_text: The term 'TRAFFIC PATTERN' refers to:
options: The flow of aircraft on the ground.
The established flight path for aircraft operating around an airport.
The sequence of aircraft for departure.
A holding pattern over a VOR.
questions.correct_answer: The established flight path for aircraft operating around an airport.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'position report'?
options: To inform ATC of the aircraft's location, altitude, and other relevant information.
To request a change in flight plan.
To get a weather update.
To declare an emergency.
questions.correct_answer: To inform ATC of the aircraft's location, altitude, and other relevant information.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'NEGATIVE CONTACT' in response to a traffic advisory means:
options: The pilot refuses to look for the traffic.
The pilot does not have the traffic in sight.
The pilot does not want to be advised of traffic.
The traffic is no longer a factor.
questions.correct_answer: The pilot does not have the traffic in sight.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between 'MAYDAY' and 'PAN-PAN'?
options: MAYDAY is for urgency, PAN-PAN is for distress.
MAYDAY is for distress (grave and imminent danger), PAN-PAN is for urgency.
MAYDAY is for medical emergencies, PAN-PAN is for mechanical issues.
There is no difference.
questions.correct_answer: MAYDAY is for distress (grave and imminent danger), PAN-PAN is for urgency.

questions.question_text: When must a pilot read back an instruction?
options: Only when requested by ATC.
All clearances and instructions involving heading, altitude, and runway assignments.
Only for takeoff and landing clearances.
Never, 'ROGER' is sufficient.
questions.correct_answer: All clearances and instructions involving heading, altitude, and runway assignments.

questions.question_text: What does 'RADAR SERVICE TERMINATED' imply?
options: The pilot should land immediately.
The controller will no longer provide radar services, and the pilot should resume own navigation and position reporting as required.
The aircraft's transponder is no longer working.
The pilot must switch to the emergency frequency.
questions.correct_answer: The controller will no longer provide radar services, and the pilot should resume own navigation and position reporting as required.

questions.question_text: An instruction 'REPORT MIDFIELD DOWNWIND' is a request to call when:
options: The aircraft is abeam the midpoint of the runway on the downwind leg.
The aircraft is turning from base to final.
The aircraft is halfway down the final approach.
The aircraft is entering the downwind leg.
questions.correct_answer: The aircraft is abeam the midpoint of the runway on the downwind leg.

questions.question_text: What is the correct initial call for a VFR flight requesting flight following from approach control?
options: Approach, Cessna 123AB, request flight following.
Boston Approach, Cessna 123AB, 10 miles west of the field at 3,500, request flight following to Providence.
Boston Approach, Cessna 123AB, over.
Request flight following, Cessna 123AB.
questions.correct_answer: Boston Approach, Cessna 123AB, 10 miles west of the field at 3,500, request flight following to Providence.

questions.question_text: What does 'CLEARED FOR IMMEDIATE TAKEOFF' mean?
options: Take off at your discretion.
Taxi onto the runway and take off without any delay.
Line up and wait for another aircraft to land.
The takeoff clearance is cancelled.
questions.correct_answer: Taxi onto the runway and take off without any delay.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'TRAFFIC IN SIGHT' is the correct response when:
options: You see any other aircraft.
You have visually acquired the specific traffic that ATC advised you of.
You are on a collision course with another aircraft.
You want ATC to stop giving you traffic advisories.
questions.correct_answer: You have visually acquired the specific traffic that ATC advised you of.

questions.question_text: What does a clearance 'MAINTAIN AT OR BELOW 4,500' mean?
options: Fly at exactly 4,500 feet.
Fly at any altitude up to and including 4,500 feet.
Descend to 4,500 feet immediately.
Climb to 4,500 feet at your discretion.
questions.correct_answer: Fly at any altitude up to and including 4,500 feet.

questions.question_text: What is a 'blind transmission'?
options: A transmission made without expecting a reply, often when the receiving station's operational status is unknown.
A transmission made on the wrong frequency.
An emergency call.
A transmission with no audio.
questions.correct_answer: A transmission made without expecting a reply, often when the receiving station's operational status is unknown.

questions.question_text: To enter Class C airspace, a VFR pilot must:
options: Squawk 1200 and monitor the frequency.
Receive a specific clearance to enter.
Establish two-way radio communication with ATC prior to entry.
Have a flight plan filed.
questions.correct_answer: Establish two-way radio communication with ATC prior to entry.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAKE A 360' means:
options: Land on runway 36.
Fly a complete circle in place.
Turn right 360 degrees.
Climb 360 feet.
questions.correct_answer: Fly a complete circle in place.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to request a 'Special VFR' clearance?
options: Requesting VFR on top.
Requesting special handling.
Requesting Special VFR clearance out of the control zone.
Declaring an emergency.
questions.correct_answer: Requesting Special VFR clearance out of the control zone.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'HOLD SHORT OF RUNWAY 27' means:
options: Cross runway 27 quickly.
Stop before reaching the runway 27 holding position marking.
Line up and wait on runway 27.
Exit the runway onto taxiway 27.
questions.correct_answer: Stop before reaching the runway 27 holding position marking.

questions.question_text: What does 'VFR-ON-TOP' clearance provide?
options: A clearance to fly at any VFR altitude.
A clearance to fly in VFR conditions while on an IFR flight plan.
A clearance to fly above a cloud layer in VFR conditions.
A special VFR clearance.
questions.correct_answer: A clearance to fly above a cloud layer in VFR conditions.

questions.question_text: If you are unable to comply with an ATC instruction, you should say:
options: NEGATIVE
DISREGARD
UNABLE
WILCO
questions.correct_answer: UNABLE

questions.question_text: What is the first thing you should do if you experience radio failure in VMC?
options: Land at the nearest airport.
Squawk 7700.
Troubleshoot the radio system (check frequency, volume, squelch, circuit breakers).
Climb to a higher altitude.
questions.correct_answer: Troubleshoot the radio system (check frequency, volume, squelch, circuit breakers).

questions.question_text: A traffic advisory 'TRAFFIC, 12 O'CLOCK, 5 MILES, OPPOSITE DIRECTION' means the traffic is:
options: Directly behind you, 5 miles away, moving away from you.
Directly ahead of you, 5 miles away, moving towards you.
To your right, 5 miles away, moving in the same direction.
To your left, 5 miles away, crossing your path.
questions.correct_answer: Directly ahead of you, 5 miles away, moving towards you.

questions.question_text: To enter Class B airspace, a VFR pilot must:
options: Establish two-way radio communication.
Have a transponder with Mode C.
Receive an explicit clearance, such as 'Cleared into the Class Bravo airspace'.
All of the above.
questions.correct_answer: All of the above.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAKE SHORT APPROACH' means:
options: Land as soon as possible on the runway.
Alter your traffic pattern to land with minimal delay.
Fly a shorter than normal final approach.
Descend rapidly on final.
questions.correct_answer: Alter your traffic pattern to land with minimal delay.

questions.question_text: What is the correct initial call for a MAYDAY message?
options: MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY, [Station Name], [Aircraft Call Sign], [Nature of Emergency].
[Station Name], [Aircraft Call Sign], MAYDAY.
MAYDAY, [Aircraft Call Sign], we have an emergency.
MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY, this is [Aircraft Call Sign], followed by position, nature of emergency, and intentions.
questions.correct_answer: MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY, this is [Aircraft Call Sign], followed by position, nature of emergency, and intentions.

questions.question_text: If you hear another station in distress, what is the first thing you should do?
options: Immediately transmit your own position.
Relay the message if the aircraft in distress is not being answered.
Change frequency to avoid interference.
Continue with your own transmission.
questions.correct_answer: Relay the message if the aircraft in distress is not being answered.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'TAXI INTO POSITION AND HOLD' is an older phraseology equivalent to:
options: HOLD SHORT
CLEARED FOR TAKEOFF
LINE UP AND WAIT
TAXI TO THE RAMP
questions.correct_answer: LINE UP AND WAIT

questions.question_text: What does 'MINIMUM FUEL' advisory to ATC indicate?
options: An emergency situation requiring immediate landing.
The aircraft's fuel supply has reached a state where, upon reaching the destination, it can accept little or no delay.
The pilot is requesting a priority landing.
The aircraft has less than 30 minutes of fuel remaining.
questions.correct_answer: The aircraft's fuel supply has reached a state where, upon reaching the destination, it can accept little or no delay.

questions.question_text: If you are given a heading to fly for radar vectors, you should:
options: Acknowledge the heading and then fly your planned course.
Read back the heading and fly it until told otherwise.
Question the controller's instruction.
Fly the heading but continue to navigate via GPS.
questions.correct_answer: Read back the heading and fly it until told otherwise.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'GO AROUND' is an instruction to:
options: Circle the airport.
Abandon the approach to land and follow ATC instructions or standard go-around procedures.
Perform a 360-degree turn on the ground.
Taxi around the airport back to the ramp.
questions.correct_answer: Abandon the approach to land and follow ATC instructions or standard go-around procedures.

questions.question_text: What is the correct response to a traffic advisory if you have the traffic in sight and it is not a factor?
options: ROGER, TRAFFIC NOT A FACTOR
TRAFFIC IN SIGHT, NO FACTOR
NEGATIVE CONTACT
TRAFFIC IN SIGHT
questions.correct_answer: TRAFFIC IN SIGHT

questions.question_text: A clearance to 'TAXI TO RUNWAY 22 VIA TAXIWAY ALPHA' requires you to:
options: Taxi to runway 22 using any taxiway, but cross Alpha.
Read back the clearance and then taxi along taxiway Alpha to the holding point for runway 22.
Proceed directly to runway 22.
Wait for further instructions before moving.
questions.correct_answer: Read back the clearance and then taxi along taxiway Alpha to the holding point for runway 22.

questions.question_text: What does the term 'NORDO' refer to?
options: An aircraft with no radio.
An aircraft flying north.
A non-radar environment.
No reported traffic.
questions.correct_answer: An aircraft with no radio.

questions.question_text: If you are approaching a non-towered airport, you should announce your position and intentions on the:
options: Guard frequency (121.5).
Local tower frequency.
Common Traffic Advisory Frequency (CTAF).
Approach control frequency.
questions.correct_answer: Common Traffic Advisory Frequency (CTAF).

questions.question_text: The instruction 'SQUAWK VFR' means to set the transponder to:
options: The code assigned by ATC.
The standard VFR code for the region (e.g., 1200 in the US).
Standby mode.
questions.correct_answer: The standard VFR code for the region (e.g., 1200 in the US).

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'SELCAL' system?
options: To automatically select the correct frequency.
To alert a flight crew that a ground station wishes to communicate with them.
A backup communication system.
A satellite phone system.
questions.correct_answer: To alert a flight crew that a ground station wishes to communicate with them.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'REPORT ESTABLISHED ON THE FINAL' means to call when:
options: You are aligned with the runway centerline on the final approach course.
You are on the base leg.
You can see the runway.
You have been cleared to land.
questions.correct_answer: You are aligned with the runway centerline on the final approach course.

questions.question_text: If you are asked 'ARE YOU VFR ON TOP?', what is the controller asking?
options: If you are flying above a cloud layer in VMC.
If you are at the top of your planned cruising altitude.
If you are using VFR for navigation.
If you are in contact with flight service.
questions.correct_answer: If you are flying above a cloud layer in VMC.

questions.question_text: What does 'CONTACT TOWER ON 118.7' mean?
options: Monitor 118.7 but do not transmit.
Switch to and communicate with the Tower on frequency 118.7 MHz.
Acknowledge the instruction on the current frequency, then switch.
Both B and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both B and C are correct.

questions.question_text: A pilot should state their altitude in an initial call to ATC, except when:
options: Departing from an airport with a functioning control tower.
Flying in Class E airspace.
The altitude is obvious.
The pilot is below 1,000 feet AGL.
questions.correct_answer: Departing from an airport with a functioning control tower.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'IDENTIFY' from ATC is a request to:
options: State your call sign.
Activate the 'IDENT' function on your transponder.
State your aircraft type.
Report your position.
questions.correct_answer: Activate the 'IDENT' function on your transponder.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of 'STOP SQUAWK'?
options: Turn the transponder to the 'OFF' or 'STBY' position.
Change your squawk code to 0000.
Stop using the 'IDENT' feature.
The transponder is malfunctioning.
questions.correct_answer: Turn the transponder to the 'OFF' or 'STBY' position.

questions.question_text: If you are given a clearance that would compromise safety, you should:
options: Comply immediately as ATC has final authority.
Refuse the clearance and state your reason (e.g., 'UNABLE, TERRAIN').
Acknowledge the clearance but fly a safer route.
Declare an emergency.
questions.correct_answer: Refuse the clearance and state your reason (e.g., 'UNABLE, TERRAIN').

questions.question_text: What does a 'runway incursion' refer to?
options: An aircraft landing without clearance.
Any occurrence at an aerodrome involving the incorrect presence of an aircraft, vehicle, or person on the protected area of a surface designated for landing and takeoff.
A bird strike on the runway.
An aircraft veering off the runway during landing.
questions.correct_answer: Any occurrence at an aerodrome involving the incorrect presence of an aircraft, vehicle, or person on the protected area of a surface designated for landing and takeoff.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'EXPEDITE CLIMB' means:
options: Climb at your normal rate.
Climb at the aircraft's maximum performance.
Climb as quickly as is safe and practical.
Climb immediately to avoid traffic.
questions.correct_answer: Climb as quickly as is safe and practical.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'sterile cockpit' rule?
options: To ensure the cockpit is clean before flight.
To prohibit non-essential conversations and activities during critical phases of flight.
To prevent unauthorized persons from entering the cockpit.
To require the use of headsets for all communications.
questions.correct_answer: To prohibit non-essential conversations and activities during critical phases of flight.

questions.question_text: If you are unsure of your position, what is the correct phrase to use?
options: MAYDAY, I AM LOST.
PAN-PAN, UNCERTAIN POSITION.
Requesting radar vectors.
Requesting position check.
questions.correct_answer: PAN-PAN, UNCERTAIN POSITION.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'CIRCLE THE AIRPORT' means:
options: Fly a standard traffic pattern.
Make a 360-degree turn over the airport.
Fly a circular path around the airport in a specified direction.
Land and taxi back to the ramp.
questions.correct_answer: Fly a circular path around the airport in a specified direction.

questions.question_text: What does 'AT-WILL' mean in a clearance, such as 'CLIMB AT-WILL'?
options: The pilot can initiate the climb at their discretion.
The pilot must climb immediately.
The pilot can choose the rate of climb.
Both A and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both A and C are correct.

questions.question_text: If you are instructed to 'MAKE RIGHT TRAFFIC FOR RUNWAY 18', you should:
options: Make all turns to the left.
Make all turns to the right when in the traffic pattern for runway 18.
Land on the right side of the runway.
Turn right after takeoff.
questions.correct_answer: Make all turns to the right when in the traffic pattern for runway 18.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of 'REPORT PASSING (fix/altitude)'?
options: Report before you reach the fix.
Report when you are at the specified fix or altitude.
Report after you have passed the fix.
Report your estimate for the fix.
questions.correct_answer: Report when you are at the specified fix or altitude.

questions.question_text: The term 'FINAL APPROACH FIX' (FAF) is primarily associated with which type of flying?
options: VFR traffic patterns.
Instrument approaches.
Aerobatic flying.
Helicopter operations.
questions.correct_answer: Instrument approaches.

questions.question_text: If you are given a frequency change, what is the correct procedure?
options: Change frequency immediately without acknowledgement.
Acknowledge the instruction, then change frequency.
Write down the frequency, then change when ready.
Wait for the controller to call you on the new frequency.
questions.correct_answer: Acknowledge the instruction, then change frequency.

questions.question_text: What does 'LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR' advisory from a tower imply?
options: A sudden, drastic change in wind speed and/or direction over a small area at low altitude.
The wind is calm near the surface.
There is a strong headwind on final approach.
Turbulence should be expected at cruising altitude.
questions.correct_answer: A sudden, drastic change in wind speed and/or direction over a small area at low altitude.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'VERIFY' is used by controllers to:
options: Request a check and confirmation of information (e.g., 'VERIFY ALTITUDE').
Confirm that your readback was correct.
Indicate that they are checking your flight plan.
Ask if you are certain about your request.
questions.correct_answer: Request a check and confirmation of information (e.g., 'VERIFY ALTITUDE').

questions.question_text: What is the correct phraseology to cancel a previously filed flight plan while airborne?
options: Tower, Cessna 123AB, cancel my flight plan.
Flight Service, Cessna 123AB, request to cancel my VFR flight plan.
Approach, Cessna 123AB, I am cancelling.
Center, Cessna 123AB, flight plan cancellation.
questions.correct_answer: Flight Service, Cessna 123AB, request to cancel my VFR flight plan.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'EXTEND DOWNWIND' means:
options: Fly a wider traffic pattern.
Continue flying on the downwind leg past the normal base turn point.
Climb on the downwind leg.
Fly the downwind leg at a slower speed.
questions.correct_answer: Continue flying on the downwind leg past the normal base turn point.

questions.question_text: What does 'RADAR CONTACT LOST' mean?
options: Your transponder has failed.
Radar identification with your aircraft has been lost and the controller can no longer see you on radar.
You have flown out of radar coverage.
Both B and C are possible.
questions.correct_answer: Both B and C are possible.

questions.question_text: If you are cleared to 'MAINTAIN BLOCK ALTITUDE 7,000 THROUGH 9,000', you are authorized to:
options: Fly at 7,000 feet or 9,000 feet only.
Fly at any altitude between 7,000 and 9,000 feet, inclusive.
Climb from 7,000 to 9,000 feet.
Descend from 9,000 to 7,000 feet.
questions.correct_answer: Fly at any altitude between 7,000 and 9,000 feet, inclusive.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'pilot report' or 'PIREP'?
options: To report other aircraft positions.
To provide real-time weather information observed by pilots in flight.
To file a complaint against ATC.
To update your ETA.
questions.correct_answer: To provide real-time weather information observed by pilots in flight.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'TURN BASE NOW' is a mandatory instruction to:
options: Turn onto the base leg at the pilot's discretion.
Immediately begin the turn onto the base leg of the traffic pattern.
Report when established on the base leg.
Fly to the start of the base leg.
questions.correct_answer: Immediately begin the turn onto the base leg of the traffic pattern.

questions.question_text: What does the term 'UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE' (Class G) imply for radio communications?
options: Radio communication is prohibited.
Radio communication is not required, but it is strongly recommended on the appropriate frequency.
You must be in contact with an ARTCC.
You must have a transponder.
questions.correct_answer: Radio communication is not required, but it is strongly recommended on the appropriate frequency.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'WHEN ABLE' in an ATC instruction means:
options: The instruction is optional.
The pilot should comply at the earliest opportunity when it is safe and practical to do so.
The pilot must comply immediately.
The pilot should report when they are able to comply.
questions.correct_answer: The pilot should comply at the earliest opportunity when it is safe and practical to do so.

questions.question_text: If you are asked to 'REPORT THE FIELD IN SIGHT', you should make a call when:
options: You are directly over the airport.
You have the airport environment (runways, buildings, etc.) visually acquired.
You see the airport beacon.
You are on the final approach.
questions.correct_answer: You have the airport environment (runways, buildings, etc.) visually acquired.

questions.question_text: What is the primary difference between a 'control zone' and a 'control area'?
options: There is no difference.
A control zone is controlled airspace extending upwards from the surface of the earth, while a control area is controlled airspace above a specified altitude.
A control zone is for IFR traffic only.
A control area is always Class B airspace.
questions.correct_answer: A control zone is controlled airspace extending upwards from the surface of the earth, while a control area is controlled airspace above a specified altitude.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAINTAIN BEST FORWARD SPEED' means:
options: Fly at the aircraft's maximum speed (Vne).
Fly at your normal cruise speed.
Fly as fast as is safe and practical for your aircraft type.
Fly at the maximum speed allowed in the airspace.
questions.correct_answer: Fly as fast as is safe and practical for your aircraft type.

questions.question_text: What does a clearance 'CROSS RUNWAY 27 AT TAXIWAY CHARLIE' mean?
options: You can cross runway 27 anywhere as long as you end up on taxiway Charlie.
You are cleared to cross runway 27 at the intersection with taxiway Charlie.
You must hold short of runway 27 at taxiway Charlie.
You are cleared to taxi on runway 27.
questions.correct_answer: You are cleared to cross runway 27 at the intersection with taxiway Charlie.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'SAY INTENTIONS' is a request for the pilot to:
options: State their destination.
State their planned course of action.
Repeat their last transmission.
Declare an emergency.
questions.correct_answer: State their planned course of action.

questions.question_text: If you are given a traffic advisory and respond 'LOOKING FOR TRAFFIC', what should you do next?
options: Continue looking and report 'TRAFFIC IN SIGHT' or 'NEGATIVE CONTACT'.
Assume ATC will keep you separated.
Immediately change heading.
End the communication.
questions.correct_answer: Continue looking and report 'TRAFFIC IN SIGHT' or 'NEGATIVE CONTACT'.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of 'CAUTION WAKE TURBULENCE'?
options: A warning that turbulence from a preceding aircraft may be encountered.
A warning of mechanical turbulence from terrain.
A warning of clear air turbulence.
A request to increase separation.
questions.correct_answer: A warning that turbulence from a preceding aircraft may be encountered.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'ORBIT RIGHT' means:
options: Make a 360-degree turn to the right.
Fly a right-hand traffic pattern.
Turn to a heading of 180 degrees.
Exit the runway to the right.
questions.correct_answer: Make a 360-degree turn to the right.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to request to transition through a Class D airspace?
options: Tower, Cessna 123AB, request transition.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, 10 miles south at 2,500, request to transition your airspace from south to north.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, flying through.
No call is required if you remain clear of the airport.
questions.correct_answer: Tower, Cessna 123AB, 10 miles south at 2,500, request to transition your airspace from south to north.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'STANDBY FOR THE TOWER' from ground control means:
options: The tower is busy, wait for them to call you.
You are cleared to contact the tower.
You will be automatically switched to the tower frequency.
Wait, and ground control will relay instructions from the tower.
questions.correct_answer: You will be automatically switched to the tower frequency.

questions.question_text: What does 'REPORT ON THE GROUND' mean?
options: Make a radio call after you have landed and cleared the runway.
Report your position on the airport diagram.
Call the tower after shutting down the engine.
Report any issues with the ground surface.
questions.correct_answer: Make a radio call after you have landed and cleared the runway.

questions.question_text: If you are told 'FREQUENCY CHANGE APPROVED', it means:
options: You must change to the new frequency immediately.
You are approved to leave the current frequency when you no longer require the service.
The controller has approved your request to change frequency.
Both B and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both B and C are correct.

questions.question_text: What is the significance of a 'hot spot' on an airport diagram?
options: A location with good radio reception.
A designated area for engine run-ups.
A location on an aerodrome with a history of potential risk of collision or runway incursion, and where heightened attention by pilots/drivers is necessary.
A fueling area.
questions.correct_answer: A location on an aerodrome with a history of potential risk of collision or runway incursion, and where heightened attention by pilots/drivers is necessary.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAINTAIN SLOWEST PRACTICAL SPEED' is often given to:
options: Save fuel.
Assist with spacing and sequencing of aircraft.
Practice slow flight.
Avoid turbulence.
questions.correct_answer: Assist with spacing and sequencing of aircraft.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between 'descend and maintain' and 'descend at pilot's discretion'?
options: There is no difference.
'Descend and maintain' requires an immediate descent, while 'at pilot's discretion' allows the pilot to start the descent when they choose.
'At pilot's discretion' allows for temporary level-offs during the descent.
Both B and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both B and C are correct.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'CLEARED AS FILED' means:
options: You are cleared to fly the route exactly as submitted in your flight plan.
Your flight plan has been received.
You are cleared for takeoff.
You are cleared to enter controlled airspace.
questions.correct_answer: You are cleared to fly the route exactly as submitted in your flight plan.

questions.question_text: What does 'CHECK GEAR DOWN' from a tower controller imply?
options: It is a mandatory order to lower the gear.
It is a reminder to verify that the landing gear is in the down and locked position.
The controller suspects a gear malfunction.
The controller cannot see your landing gear.
questions.correct_answer: It is a reminder to verify that the landing gear is in the down and locked position.

questions.question_text: The term 'SIDESTEP' is used to:
options: Instruct a pilot to maneuver to the side to avoid traffic.
Instruct a pilot to land on a parallel runway after commencing an approach to another.
Describe a taxiing maneuver.
Describe a type of crosswind landing.
questions.correct_answer: Instruct a pilot to land on a parallel runway after commencing an approach to another.

questions.question_text: If you are given a clearance containing the phrase 'VIA (route or fix)', you must:
options: Fly over the specified route or fix.
Avoid the specified route or fix.
Report passing the route or fix.
Consider the instruction as a suggestion.
questions.correct_answer: Fly over the specified route or fix.

questions.question_text: What does the term 'vectors to final' mean?
options: The pilot will navigate to the final approach course.
ATC will provide headings to intercept the final approach course.
The final approach is not available.
The pilot should expect a visual approach.
questions.correct_answer: ATC will provide headings to intercept the final approach course.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'REPORT YOUR FLIGHT CONDITIONS' is a request for:
options: A PIREP, specifically whether you are in VMC or IMC.
Your aircraft's performance data.
Your fuel status.
Your emotional state.
questions.correct_answer: A PIREP, specifically whether you are in VMC or IMC.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of a 'visual approach' clearance?
options: It is an IFR clearance that allows the pilot to proceed visually to the airport.
It is a VFR procedure.
It requires the pilot to remain clear of clouds.
Both A and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both A and C are correct.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'HOLD POSITION' on the ground means:
options: Stop moving immediately and remain in your current position.
Hold short of the next taxiway.
Return to the ramp.
Wait for further instructions before proceeding.
questions.correct_answer: Stop moving immediately and remain in your current position.

questions.question_text: What is a 'short field takeoff' clearance?
options: A clearance to use less than the full runway length.
A clearance to perform a takeoff using maximum performance techniques.
A clearance to take off from a short runway.
There is no such ATC clearance; it is a pilot technique.
questions.correct_answer: There is no such ATC clearance; it is a pilot technique.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'REMAIN THIS FREQUENCY' means:
options: Do not change to another frequency until advised.
The current frequency is the only one available.
Acknowledge and wait for a new frequency.
The radio is not working correctly.
questions.correct_answer: Do not change to another frequency until advised.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'UNICOM' station?
options: To provide air traffic control services.
To provide airport advisory information at non-towered airports.
To broadcast weather information only.
To communicate with company aircraft.
questions.correct_answer: To provide airport advisory information at non-towered airports.

questions.question_text: If you are told 'TRAFFIC NO LONGER A FACTOR', it means:
options: The traffic has landed.
The traffic is no longer a threat to your flight path.
You should stop looking for the traffic.
Both B and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both B and C are correct.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'FLY RUNWAY HEADING' means:
options: Fly a heading that is parallel to the runway.
Fly a heading that is the magnetic direction of the runway centerline.
Fly towards the runway.
Fly a heading of 360 degrees.
questions.correct_answer: Fly a heading that is the magnetic direction of the runway centerline.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between 'taxi into position and hold' and 'line up and wait'?
options: There is no difference; 'line up and wait' is the current standard phraseology.
'Taxi into position and hold' is used for helicopters.
'Line up and wait' is used only at night.
'Taxi into position and hold' means to wait on the taxiway.
questions.correct_answer: There is no difference; 'line up and wait' is the current standard phraseology.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'SAY ALTITUDE' is a request for the pilot to:
options: Report their current indicated altitude.
Verify their assigned altitude.
State their desired cruising altitude.
Report their altitude in feet above sea level.
questions.correct_answer: Report their current indicated altitude.

questions.question_text: What does a 'contact approach' allow a pilot to do?
options: Fly to the airport by visual reference to the ground, clear of clouds, with at least 1 mile flight visibility.
Contact the tower for landing clearance.
Approach the airport without an IFR clearance.
Make contact with another aircraft.
questions.correct_answer: Fly to the airport by visual reference to the ground, clear of clouds, with at least 1 mile flight visibility.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'GIVE WAY TO (aircraft type and position)' means:
options: Allow the other aircraft to pass before you proceed.
Follow the other aircraft.
Pass behind the other aircraft.
All of the above could be appropriate actions.
questions.correct_answer: All of the above could be appropriate actions.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to report leaving an altitude?
options: Cessna 123AB, leaving three thousand five hundred.
Cessna 123AB, out of three thousand five hundred for two thousand five hundred.
Cessna 123AB, starting descent.
Cessna 123AB, descending.
questions.correct_answer: Cessna 123AB, out of three thousand five hundred for two thousand five hundred.

questions.question_text: The term 'BLOCKED' during a transmission means:
options: The frequency is busy.
The transmission was unreadable due to simultaneous transmissions.
The runway is blocked.
The radio is broken.
questions.correct_answer: The transmission was unreadable due to simultaneous transmissions.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'holding pattern'?
options: To practice turns.
A predetermined maneuver that keeps an aircraft within a specified airspace while awaiting further clearance.
A racetrack pattern for landing.
A sightseeing maneuver.
questions.correct_answer: A predetermined maneuver that keeps an aircraft within a specified airspace while awaiting further clearance.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAINTAIN VISUAL SEPARATION' from ATC means:
options: The pilot is responsible for maintaining a safe distance from another aircraft that they have in sight.
ATC will no longer provide traffic advisories.
The pilot should fly in VMC.
Both A and C are correct.
questions.correct_answer: The pilot is responsible for maintaining a safe distance from another aircraft that they have in sight.

questions.question_text: What is the correct phraseology to request a practice instrument approach?
options: Requesting practice approach.
Approach, Cessna 123AB, 10 miles north, request practice ILS runway 22 approach.
Approach, Cessna 123AB, request IFR practice.
Approach, Cessna 123AB, need to practice.
questions.correct_answer: Approach, Cessna 123AB, 10 miles north, request practice ILS runway 22 approach.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'REPORT REACHING' is a request to:
options: Report when you have arrived at a specific altitude or fix.
Report your estimated time of arrival.
Report when you are able to reach a certain speed.
Report when you have reached your destination.
questions.correct_answer: Report when you have arrived at a specific altitude or fix.

questions.question_text: What does a 'LAHSO' clearance stand for?
options: Land And Hold Short Operations.
Low Altitude Helicopter Safety Operations.
Landing And Heading South Operations.
Light Aircraft High Speed Operations.
questions.correct_answer: Land And Hold Short Operations.

questions.question_text: Is a pilot required to accept a LAHSO clearance?
options: Yes, it is a mandatory instruction.
No, the pilot in command has the final authority to accept or decline a LAHSO clearance.
Only if the aircraft is capable of stopping in the available distance.
Only if the weather is VMC.
questions.correct_answer: No, the pilot in command has the final authority to accept or decline a LAHSO clearance.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'TAXI TO THE RAMP' means:
options: Taxi to a specific parking spot.
Taxi to the general non-movement area for parking.
Taxi via the ramp.
Hold short of the ramp.
questions.correct_answer: Taxi to the general non-movement area for parking.

questions.question_text: What does 'IF NO CONTACT, (do something)' mean in a clearance?
options: It is a lost communication procedure to be followed if radio contact is lost.
It is a suggestion for the pilot.
It is an optional part of the clearance.
It is a reminder to check the radio.
questions.correct_answer: It is a lost communication procedure to be followed if radio contact is lost.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'SAY FUEL REMAINING' is a request for:
options: The amount of fuel on board in gallons or pounds.
The amount of fuel on board in hours and minutes of flight time.
The pilot to declare minimum fuel.
The fuel consumption rate.
questions.correct_answer: The amount of fuel on board in hours and minutes of flight time.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between 'holding short' and 'holding in position'?
options: There is no difference.
'Holding short' refers to stopping before a runway, while 'holding position' refers to stopping anywhere on a taxiway.
'Holding short' is for aircraft, 'holding position' is for vehicles.
'Holding in position' is an emergency instruction.
questions.correct_answer: 'Holding short' refers to stopping before a runway, while 'holding position' refers to stopping anywhere on a taxiway.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'REMAIN CLEAR OF THE CLASS BRAVO' means:
options: Do not enter the Class B airspace.
You are cleared to enter the Class B airspace.
Fly over the top of the Class B airspace.
Fly under the floor of the Class B airspace.
questions.correct_answer: Do not enter the Class B airspace.

questions.question_text: What does a 'progressive taxi' instruction mean?
options: The pilot should taxi without stopping.
The controller will provide step-by-step taxi instructions.
The pilot should use all available taxiways.
The pilot should taxi at a high speed.
questions.correct_answer: The controller will provide step-by-step taxi instructions.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'CONFIRM' is used to:
options: Verify that a readback was correct.
Request verification of an instruction or information.
Acknowledge an instruction.
Agree with a statement.
questions.correct_answer: Request verification of an instruction or information.

questions.question_text: What is the correct response if you do not understand an instruction?
options: ROGER
SAY AGAIN
WILCO
Remain silent.
questions.correct_answer: SAY AGAIN

questions.question_text: The term 'AIRMET' on an ATIS broadcast refers to:
options: Airman's Meteorological Information, concerning weather phenomena that may affect all aircraft.
A severe weather warning.
A notice to airmen about airport conditions.
A military training route.
questions.correct_answer: Airman's Meteorological Information, concerning weather phenomena that may affect all aircraft.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAINTAIN AT LEAST 5 MILES SEPARATION' is an example of:
options: A visual separation instruction.
A radar separation instruction.
A pilot-applied spacing instruction.
A holding instruction.
questions.correct_answer: A pilot-applied spacing instruction.

questions.question_text: What does 'AT YOUR DISCRETION' mean when used in a clearance?
options: The pilot can choose to comply or not.
The pilot has the choice of when and how to execute the maneuver.
The instruction is not important.
The controller is busy.
questions.correct_answer: The pilot has the choice of when and how to execute the maneuver.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'REPORT TRAFFIC IN SIGHT' is a request to:
options: Report when you see any traffic.
Report when you see the specific traffic that was just pointed out.
Report if the traffic is a threat.
Report the type of traffic.
questions.correct_answer: Report when you see the specific traffic that was just pointed out.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to report a bird strike to ATC?
options: MAYDAY, BIRD STRIKE.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, we've experienced a bird strike, remaining in the pattern to assess.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, bird strike.
No report is necessary unless there is damage.
questions.correct_answer: Tower, Cessna 123AB, we've experienced a bird strike, remaining in the pattern to assess.

questions.question_text: The term 'SIGMET' on an ATIS broadcast refers to:
options: Significant Meteorological Information, concerning weather potentially hazardous to all aircraft.
A minor weather advisory.
A notice about airport construction.
A special instrument approach.
questions.correct_answer: Significant Meteorological Information, concerning weather potentially hazardous to all aircraft.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'CLEARED FOR TAKEOFF, NO DELAY' means:
options: Take off when ready.
You are cleared for takeoff but must do so immediately to avoid delaying other traffic.
A delay is expected after takeoff.
The takeoff clearance is about to be cancelled.
questions.correct_answer: You are cleared for takeoff but must do so immediately to avoid delaying other traffic.

questions.question_text: What does the phrase 'WORDS TWICE' mean when used as a request?
options: Repeat the last two words.
Communication is difficult, please say every word or phrase twice.
Speak twice as loud.
The message is very important.
questions.correct_answer: Communication is difficult, please say every word or phrase twice.

questions.question_text: If you are given a complex taxi instruction and are unsure, you should:
options: Taxi slowly and figure it out.
Acknowledge the instruction and hope for the best.
Admit you are unfamiliar and request progressive taxi instructions.
Refuse to taxi.
questions.correct_answer: Admit you are unfamiliar and request progressive taxi instructions.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'STAND BY FOR (message)' means:
options: Wait, a message is coming.
The frequency is busy.
Your request is denied.
Acknowledge and wait.
questions.correct_answer: Wait, a message is coming.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to report your aircraft type if it is not obvious?
options: State the manufacturer and model (e.g., 'Cessna 172').
State the general category (e.g., 'single-engine piston').
State the ICAO type designator (e.g., 'C172').
All of the above are acceptable depending on the context.
questions.correct_answer: All of the above are acceptable depending on the context.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'MAINTAIN RUNWAY HEADING UNTIL REACHING 2,000 FEET' is an example of:
options: A noise abatement procedure.
A standard departure instruction.
A traffic avoidance maneuver.
All of the above.
questions.correct_answer: All of the above.

questions.question_text: What does 'BREAK' mean when used by a pilot in a transmission?
options: To indicate the separation between parts of a message.
To signal the end of a transmission.
To request a pause.
To indicate an emergency.
questions.correct_answer: To indicate the separation between parts of a message.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'THAT IS APPROVED' from ATC means:
options: Your request has been granted.
Your readback was correct.
You are cleared to proceed.
The procedure is standard.
questions.correct_answer: Your request has been granted.

questions.question_text: If you are on an IFR flight plan and lose two-way radio communications, you should set your transponder to:
The phrase 'WHEN READY TO DEPART' means:
options: You are cleared for takeoff.
You should call the tower when you are number one for departure.
You should call the tower when you are ready for takeoff at the runway.
You can depart without a clearance.
questions.correct_answer: You should call the tower when you are ready for takeoff at the runway.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of the 'common traffic advisory frequency' (CTAF)?
options: To receive air traffic control.
For pilots to communicate their positions and intentions to each other at non-towered airports.
To get weather information.
To file flight plans.
questions.correct_answer: For pilots to communicate their positions and intentions to each other at non-towered airports.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'EXIT RUNWAY AT THE NEXT TAXIWAY' means:
options: Exit the runway at any taxiway you choose.
Exit the runway at the first available taxiway.
Exit the runway at the taxiway designated as 'Next'.
Continue to the end of the runway.
questions.correct_answer: Exit the runway at the first available taxiway.

questions.question_text: What does the term 'FSS' stand for in aviation communications?
options: Flight Safety Service
Flight Service Station
Federal Sky Service
Flight Sequencing System
questions.correct_answer: Flight Service Station

questions.question_text: The instruction 'CHANGE TO ADVISORY FREQUENCY' means:
options: Change to 121.5 MHz.
Change to the CTAF or UNICOM frequency for the airport.
Change to the tower frequency.
The controller will advise you of the new frequency.
questions.correct_answer: Change to the CTAF or UNICOM frequency for the airport.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to report a rough running engine?
options: MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY, engine failure.
PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, experiencing a rough running engine, request to return to the field.
Tower, we have an engine problem.
No call is needed unless the engine quits.
questions.correct_answer: PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, experiencing a rough running engine, request to return to the field.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'VIA FLIGHT PLAN ROUTE' means:
options: Proceed via the route you filed in your flight plan.
The controller will give you your route.
The flight plan is approved.
Fly direct to your destination.
questions.correct_answer: Proceed via the route you filed in your flight plan.

questions.question_text: What does a clearance 'MAINTAIN VFR, AT OR BELOW 2,500' mean?
options: Fly at exactly 2,500 feet.
Fly at any altitude up to and including 2,500 feet, while remaining in VFR conditions.
Descend to 2,500 feet immediately.
This is an IFR clearance.
questions.correct_answer: Fly at any altitude up to and including 2,500 feet, while remaining in VFR conditions.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'REPORT ESTABLISHED' means:
options: Report when you have established communication.
Report when you are established on a specific course, route, or in a holding pattern.
Report when you have established visual contact.
Report when you are established at your cruising altitude.
questions.correct_answer: Report when you are established on a specific course, route, or in a holding pattern.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of 'CLEARED THROUGH THE ZONE'?
options: You are cleared to transition through a specific airspace, usually a control zone.
You are cleared to land.
You are cleared to take off.
You are cleared to enter a military operations area.
questions.correct_answer: You are cleared to transition through a specific airspace, usually a control zone.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'FOLLOW THE (aircraft type)' means:
options: Maintain a safe distance and visually follow the preceding aircraft.
Fly in formation with the other aircraft.
Follow the other aircraft's flight plan.
Communicate with the other aircraft.
questions.correct_answer: Maintain a safe distance and visually follow the preceding aircraft.

questions.question_text: What does 'READBACK CORRECT' from ATC signify?
options: The controller is confirming that your repetition of a clearance was accurate.
The controller is correcting your readback.
The controller is asking you to read back the clearance again.
The controller is giving you a new clearance.
questions.correct_answer: The controller is confirming that your repetition of a clearance was accurate.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'SAY TYPE AIRCRAFT' is a request for:
options: Your aircraft's call sign.
Your aircraft's manufacturer and model.
Your aircraft's color.
Your aircraft's speed.
questions.correct_answer: Your aircraft's manufacturer and model.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a 'NOTAM'?
options: To provide weather forecasts.

To disseminate information concerning the establishment, condition, or change in any aeronautical facility, service, procedure, or hazard, the timely knowledge of which is essential to personnel concerned with flight operations.
To issue air traffic control clearances.
To report aircraft accidents.
questions.correct_answer: To disseminate information concerning the establishment, condition, or change in any aeronautical facility, service, procedure, or hazard, the timely knowledge of which is essential to personnel concerned with flight operations.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'TAXI INTO THE PENALTY BOX' is an informal term for:
options: A designated parking area for aircraft that have violated a rule.
A run-up area or a location away from the main taxiways to wait for clearance.
The customs and immigration area.
The maintenance hangar.
questions.correct_answer: A run-up area or a location away from the main taxiways to wait for clearance.

questions.question_text: What does 'REPORT YOUR CALL SIGN' mean?
options: The controller has missed your call sign and is asking you to repeat it.
The controller is testing your radio.
The controller is asking for your aircraft type.
The controller is about to give you a new squawk code.
questions.correct_answer: The controller has missed your call sign and is asking you to repeat it.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'EXPECT (altitude) IN (time or distance)' is used to:
options: Provide advance notice of a future altitude clearance.
Issue a mandatory altitude change.
Ask the pilot if they can reach an altitude.
Confirm the pilot's requested altitude.
questions.correct_answer: Provide advance notice of a future altitude clearance.

questions.question_text: What is the correct way to respond to a conditional clearance like 'BEHIND THE LANDING CESSNA, LINE UP AND WAIT'?
options: WILCO.
ROGER.
BEHIND THE LANDING CESSNA, LINE UP AND WAIT, CESSNA 123AB.
LINE UP AND WAIT, CESSNA 123AB.
questions.correct_answer: BEHIND THE LANDING CESSNA, LINE UP AND WAIT, CESSNA 123AB.

questions.question_text: The term 'FLIGHT FOLLOWING' refers to:
options: A mandatory ATC service.
A radar service provided to VFR aircraft on a workload-permitting basis to provide traffic advisories.
A service for filing flight plans.
A service that provides continuous weather updates.
questions.correct_answer: A radar service provided to VFR aircraft on a workload-permitting basis to provide traffic advisories.

questions.question_text: If you are told 'RADAR SERVICES ARE NOT AVAILABLE', it means:
options: The controller's radar is out of service, and they cannot provide radar-based services.
You must turn off your transponder.
You must proceed VFR.
You must land at the nearest airport.
questions.correct_answer: The controller's radar is out of service, and they cannot provide radar-based services.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'I SAY AGAIN' is used to:
options: Request a repeat of a message.
Emphasize a message that is being re-transmitted.
Correct a mistake.
Acknowledge a message.
questions.correct_answer: Emphasize a message that is being re-transmitted.

questions.question_text: What does a clearance 'JOIN THE FINAL' mean?
options: Intercept and fly the final approach course.
Join the traffic pattern on the final leg.
Report when on final.
Both A and B are correct.
questions.correct_answer: Both A and B are correct.

questions.question_text: The instruction 'CONTINUE' or 'CONTINUE APPROACH' means:
options: You are cleared to land.
Continue on your current track or approach, but landing clearance is not yet issued.
Continue with your request.
The frequency is clear.
questions.correct_answer: Continue on your current track or approach, but landing clearance is not yet issued.

questions.question_text: What is the correct phrase to use when you are ready for departure from the end of the runway?
options: Tower, Cessna 123AB, ready to go.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, runway 22, ready for departure.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, taking off now.
Tower, Cessna 123AB, request takeoff clearance.
questions.correct_answer: Tower, Cessna 123AB, runway 22, ready for departure.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'EXPEDITE TAXI' means:
options: Taxi at a normal speed.
Taxi as quickly as is safe to avoid delaying other traffic.
Taxi via the most direct route.
Stop taxiing.
questions.correct_answer: Taxi as quickly as is safe to avoid delaying other traffic.

questions.question_text: What does 'REPORT ABORTING TAKEOFF' mean?
options: Inform ATC if you decide to reject the takeoff.
Report when the takeoff is complete.
Report any issues during the takeoff roll.
This is not standard phraseology.
questions.correct_answer: Inform ATC if you decide to reject the takeoff.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'SAY SOULS ON BOARD' is a request for:
options: The number of passengers.
The total number of people (crew and passengers) on the aircraft.
The weight of the passengers.
The names of the people on board.
questions.correct_answer: The total number of people (crew and passengers) on the aircraft.

questions.question_text: If you are instructed to 'MAKE A LEFT 270-DEGREE TURN FOR SPACING', you should:
options: Make a right turn of 90 degrees.
Make a left turn of 270 degrees.
Make a left 360-degree turn.
Both A and B will result in the correct final heading.
questions.correct_answer: Both A and B will result in the correct final heading.

questions.question_text: The phrase 'CLEARED FOR TAKEOFF, TURN RIGHT HEADING 320' requires you to:
options: Turn to a heading of 320 before starting the takeoff roll.
Read back the clearance, take off, and begin a right turn to a heading of 320 once safely airborne.
Take off and fly the runway heading first.
Question the instruction as it is non-standard.
questions.correct_answer: Read back the clearance, take off, and begin a right turn to a heading of 320 once safely airborne.
